description: Single storey side to rear extension
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size:12pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="line-height:normal">The proposed single storey side to rear&nbsp;extension by reason of its siting, excessive depth, width and bulk would result in a loss of outlook, light and&nbsp;overshadowing and a visually&nbsp;overbearing and obtrusive development to the occupiers of No.526 Kenton Lane, to the detriment of their residential amenities, contrary to&nbsp;the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3 D.7 of The&nbsp; London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span></span></span><br></p>

<p style="padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt"><span style="font-size:12pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="line-height:107%">The proposed single storey side to rear extension, by reason of its excessive width, bulk and prominent siting, would give rise to an incongruous, bulky and unduly obtrusive form of development in the street scene and would fail to respect the pattern of development in the area, to the detriment of the character and appearance of the host dwellinghouse, street scene and locality, contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023<strong>), </strong>Policy D3 D(1) and D(11) of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span></span></span></p><p><br data-cke-eol="1"></p>
